FLANKER.WELCOME_MESSAGE: Thank you for participating in this study. You will be performing an Eriksen Flanker task.
FLANKER.INSTRUCTIONS_OVERVIEW: In this task, you will see a row of five symbols on the screen. The middle symbol is always an arrow pointing either left or right. Your job is to identify the direction of the middle arrow and respond accordingly, ignoring the surrounding symbols.
FLANKER.INSTRUCTIONS_CENTER_FOCUS: Remember to focus on the center arrow. The surrounding symbols may or may not point in the same direction, but you should only respond based on the center arrow.
FLANKER.TASK_RULES_DESCRIPTION: There are three types of trials:
FLANKER.CONGRUENT_DESC: All five arrows point in the same direction.
FLANKER.INCONGRUENT_DESC: The center arrow points in one direction, but the surrounding arrows point in the opposite direction.
FLANKER.NEUTRAL_DESC: The surrounding symbols are dashes (â€”), only the center arrow conveys direction.
FLANKER.RESPONSE_LEFT: If the CENTER arrow points LEFT, press the LEFT arrow key (or click on the left side of the screen).
FLANKER.RESPONSE_RIGHT: If the CENTER arrow points RIGHT, press the RIGHT arrow key (or click on the right side of the screen).
FLANKER.IGNORE_FLANKERS: Important: You must ignore the direction of the surrounding symbols and only respond to the center arrow.
FLANKER.SPEED_ACCURACY_BALANCE: Try to be both fast and accurate. Both speed and accuracy are important for this task.
FLANKER.PRACTICE_INTRO_MESSAGE: Before the main task, you will complete a short practice session. This will help you get familiar with the task and understand how to distinguish the center arrow from the surrounding symbols.

translations.WELCOME_MESSAGE: Thank you for participating in this study. You will be performing an n-back working memory task.
translations.TASK_DESCRIPTION_1: In this task, you will see numbers displayed one at a time. Your job is to decide if the current number matches the number that appeared 1 position back in the sequence.
translations.TASK_DESCRIPTION_2: In this task, you will see numbers displayed one at a time. Your job is to decide if the current number matches the number that appeared 2 positions back in the sequence.
translations.TASK_DESCRIPTION_3: In this task, you will see numbers displayed one at a time. Your job is to decide if the current number matches the number that appeared 3 positions back in the sequence.
translations.TASK_DESCRIPTION_4: In this task, you will see numbers displayed one at a time. Your job is to decide if the current number matches the number that appeared 4 positions back in the sequence.
translations.INSTRUCTIONS_OVERVIEW: In this task, you will see a sequence of single-digit numbers (0-9) appearing one at a time on the screen. Each number will be displayed for a short time, followed by a brief pause before the next number appears.
translations.INSTRUCTIONS_SEQUENCE: The task is to monitor the sequence and respond when you notice a pattern.
translations.TASK_RULES_1: When you see a number that matches the number from 1 position back, press the spacebar (or click the mouse) as quickly as possible.
translations.TASK_RULES_2: When you see a number that matches the number from 2 positions back, press the spacebar (or click the mouse) as quickly as possible.
translations.TASK_RULES_3: When you see a number that matches the number from 3 positions back, press the spacebar (or click the mouse) as quickly as possible.
translations.TASK_RULES_4: When you see a number that matches the number from 4 positions back, press the spacebar (or click the mouse) as quickly as possible.
translations.EXAMPLES_1: Example: If you see the sequence 3 - 3, you should respond when you see the second 3 because it matches the 3 from 1 position back. A sequence like 4 - 3 - 4 is not a match, because they are not immediately adjacent, so you would NOT respond.
translations.EXAMPLES_2: Example: If you see the sequence 3 - 7 - 3, you should respond when you see the second 3 because it matches the 3 from 2 position back. A sequence like 4 - 4 is not a match, because they are immediately adjacent, so you would NOT respond.
translations.EXAMPLES_3: Example: If you see the sequence 5 - 2 - 8 - 5, you should respond when you see the second 5 because it matches the 5 from 3 positions back. A sequence like 8 - 3 - 8 is only a 1-back match, so for 2-back you would NOT respond.
translations.EXAMPLES_4: Example: If you see the sequence 1 - 4 - 7 - 2 - 1, you should respond when you see the second 1 because it matches the 1 from 4 positions back.
translations.RESPONSE_WHEN_MATCH: When you see a number that matches the target number from n positions back, respond immediately by pressing the spacebar or clicking the mouse.
translations.RESPONSE_WHEN_NO_MATCH: When you see a number that does NOT match, do nothing. Simply wait for the next number to appear.
translations.SPEED_ACCURACY_BALANCE: Try to be both fast and accurate. Both speed and accuracy are important for this task.
translations.PRACTICE_INTRO_MESSAGE: Before the main task, you will complete a short practice session. This will help you get familiar with the task.

PRACTICE.FEEDBACK_TEXT: Thank you for completing the practice session. Here are your results:
PRACTICE.PRESS_TO_CONTINUE: Press spacebar to continue to the main task

MAIN_TASK.PRESS_TO_BEGIN: Press spacebar to begin the main task

SETTINGS.NEUTRAL_PERCENTAGE_HELP: Percentage of trials where flankers are dashes (remaining after congruent + incongruent)

SETTINGS.SHOW_FIXATION_CROSS: Show fixation cross during inter-trial interval
SETTINGS.DISPLAY_DURATION_HELP: How long each number is shown (100-2000 ms)
